result.execSummary:
The defendant Blake Anthony Ziemba was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to obtain his GED or HSED while on probation.

Defendant to obtain/maintain full time employment in an occupation acceptable to agent and not quit employment without agent approval.

No contact with R.M.M. or E.K.D. or their residences.

No unsupervised contact with females under the age of 18 years except incidental contact.

Comply with any no contact orders per agent.

Defendant to register as a sex offender.  
**4/28/2016 - JOC amended - Language "Register for a period of 12 years" removed.

Sex offender assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.

Comply with any treatment, assessments and programming per agent.

Submit DNA sample; not required to pay DNA surcharge.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain full time employment in an occupation acceptable to agent and not voluntarily quit employment without agent's approval.

Comply with Wisconsin's Sex Offender Registry Program.

Comply with any assessments, treatment and programming ordered by agent.

No unsupervised contact with females under the age of 18 except for incidental contact.

Obey any no contact orders per agent.

No consumption or possession of alcoholic beverages; no entering taverns, bars or liquor stores for any reason.

No consumption or possession of any controlled substances except those legally prescribed to defendant and take prescribed medications exactly as directed to be taken.

No possession of drug paraphernalia.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Blake Anthony Ziemba
